summary: The Financial Reporting Threshold Modernization Act aims to update financial reporting requirements. It mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to revise regulations related to currency transaction reports (CTRs) and suspicious activity reports (SARs), increasing the reporting thresholds for certain transactions. Specifically, it raises the CTR threshold from $10,000 to $30,000 and the SAR threshold from $5,000 to $10,000 and $2,000 to $3,000.  It also updates the money services business definition thresholds. The bill requires future adjustments to account for inflation.
